captions.text:
Once upon a time, Johnny Depp was the most
intriguing actor in Hollywood

Now, one hit franchise will usher in the end
of his creative choices, turning him into
But who cares? Now he owns a f**king island.

Witness the Disneyfication of pirates, history’s
most notorious foul-mouthed rapists and murderers

"Raid, pillage, plunder and otherwise pilfer
my weasely black guts out."

Buckle your swashes for Curse of the Black
Pearl, a straightforward adventure romp that

then Dead Man’s Chest, that everyone was
sort of on-board for, where they all betray

each other to find a
teleporting squid monster’s heart

At World’s End that everyone was totally
fed up with, where they all betray each other

while the squid monster teams up with the
British East India company

causing the pirate U.N. to release a sea goddess
who’s in love with the squid monster, except
and On Stranger Tides, that finally --
wait, what? They made a 4th one?

How many of these things can they do? They're
based on a f**king theme park ride for god's
Johnny Depp shines as Jack Sparrow

the legendary pirate made out of dreadlocks
and guyliner.

Watch this Oscar-worthy match between actor
and role as he hams it up with a trademark

in this half-drunk Keith Richards impression
that really should be dead by now

"Does this face look like it's been to the
fountain of youth?"

Spend the rest of your time in the pale embrace
of the boring lovers Orlando Bloom and Keira

two perfect faces in the middle of a scurvy
ridden hellhole

whose will-they-won’t-they relationship
will have everyone

until they're replaced in the 4th one by their
cheaper, but just as pale, equivalents.

Baton down the hatches for nearly 10 overstuffed
maritime hours of
"Yo ho, a pirate's life for me."

and women dressed in cinema's least-convincing
boy disguises.

Mustache or not, I would totally pork that
dude.

Captain Jack Spare Us From Any More of These
Movies,

Jack Sparrow of the Caribbean (And Some Other
Pirates).
You used to be cool, man!
What the hell happened to you?

"Close your eyes and pretend it's all a bad
dream. That's how I get by."

title: Honest Trailers - Pirates of the Caribbean

comments.author: kyuubicat5

comments.text:
The first movie was so great (and now that Disney owns LucasArts they can 
retro-justify ripping off Monkey Island), so there's little to bitch about 
there. POTC:COTBP was one of the more memorable movies of the last couple 
of decades.

I'm thinking we should cut Depp some slack, he's gone through an ugly 
divorce and he's still made so may great films that some sort of crisis was 
bound to happen.
Transcendence was a snoozefest, but that's not really his fault. Rum Diary 
was fucking awesome and for some reason I still love and will continue to 
love Secret Window.

Honestly I'd probably do all this for my own island (with higher topology 
so that when the oceans rise it's not an underwater island).﻿

comments.author: Ryuu Games

comments.text:
As with many movie series, the 1st one was good, the 2nd mediocre bordering 
on bad, the 3rd trash and after that they should have realized how bad it 
was and NOT made another one!
Seriously, out of the Pirates of the Carribean movies, I only really 
enjoyed the 1st one; in the other ones, Depp simply didn't carry the 
stories enough to make them really work, and there were too many new 
characters and too much CGI causing too much action and distractions. When 
there's so much action you start wondering what the hell the movie is about 
in the first place, the story simply isn't really being carried well 
enough. Just my opinion.﻿

just so good... But they really should've stopped after the trilogy. The 
fourth one was terrible, no one liked it. The fifth one will have Orlando 
Bloom again, so maybe they will return to the original cast. I have high 
hopes for it. I just don't understand what's up with the name. Dead Man 
Tells No Tales. It's been mentioned in previous Pirates movies (Cotton's 
parrot says it in the first one, Calipso says it in the third one). Is it 
important?﻿
